Detailed Description

Class which encapsulates the functionality of adding overlay information onto the map.

Layers are automatically created(if they do not exist) when referenced in overlay item adding operations. Layers are drawn in ascending order, where a larger layer number will result in the layer being drawn later.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool WFAPI::OverlayInterface::addOverlayItem ( OverlayItem *  overlayItem,
layer_id_t  layerID 
) [pure virtual]

Add the overlay item to the layer.

Increases the reference count of the overlay item for the duration of its lifetime within the layer.

Parameters:
overlayItem The item to be added.
layerID The id of the layer that the overlay item should be placed on.
Returns:
Will return false if the overlayItem already exists within the layer.

virtual bool WFAPI::OverlayInterface::addOverlayItems ( const OverlayItemVector &  overlayItems,
layer_id_t  layerID 
) [pure virtual]

Add multiple overlay items to a layer. More efficient than adding them one by one.

Increases the reference count for all the overlay items for the duration of its lifetime within the layer.

Parameters:
overlayItems Vector of items to be added.
layerID The id of the layer that the overlay item should be placed on.
Returns:
Will return false if the overlayItem already exists within the layer.

virtual void WFAPI::OverlayInterface::clearLayer ( layer_id_t  layerID  )  [pure virtual]

Clear the layer and remove all associated content.

Parameters:
layerID The layer to clear.

virtual const OverlayItem* WFAPI::OverlayInterface::getCurrentHighlightedItem (  )  [pure virtual]

Get the current highlighted item. If no item is currently highlighted, NULL will be returned.

Returns:
The current highlighted item, NULL if no item is highlighted.

virtual bool WFAPI::OverlayInterface::getLayerVisible ( layer_id_t  layerID  )  const [pure virtual]

Get if the layer is visible.

Parameters:

virtual bool WFAPI::OverlayInterface::removeOverlayItem ( OverlayItem *  overlayItem,
layer_id_t  layerID 
) [pure virtual]

Remove a specific overlay item from a specified layer. Returns true if the item was successfully removed.

Parameters:

layerID The id of the layer containing the OverlayItem.
